metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7169 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the File_Upload_Upgrader class in wp-admin/includes/class-file-upload-upgrader.php in the upgrade package uploader in WordPress before 4.6.1 allows remote authenticated users to access arbitrary files via a crafted urlholder parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-7169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwenty - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentytwentyone - 4.6.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.6.1+dfsg-1').
